article.title: Theo de Raadt: Pioneering Open Source Advocate and OpenBSD Founder

body.p: Theo de Raadt is a prominent figure in the open-source software community, best known as the founder and leader of the OpenBSD operating system project. His work has significantly influenced the development of secure and reliable open-source software.
For more detailed information, refer to the original article.

article.title: The Birth of Debian, in the Words of Ian Murdock Himself

body.p: In this article, Ian Murdock, the founder of Debian, reflects on the origins of the Debian project. He discusses his motivations for creating a new Linux distribution, emphasizing the importance of community involvement and the principles of open-source development. Murdock provides insights into the early challenges faced by the project and how Debian aimed to provide a high-quality, community-driven alternative to existing distributions.
For more detailed information, refer to the original article, the 1993 Debian announcement, or the Debian Project History page.

article.title: FreeBSD: An Open Source Alternative to Linux

body.p: This article by Dru Lavigne explores the distinctions between FreeBSD and Linux, highlighting FreeBSD's unified approach as a complete operating system, its BSD licensing advantages, and its streamlined development process.
